casebody.data:
891 A.2d 327 ATTORNEY GRIEVANCE COMMISSION OF MARYLAND v. Eric Jag KAPOOR. Misc. Docket AG Nos. 3 & 9,

Sept. Term, 2005.

Court of Appeals of Maryland. Feb. 3, 2006.

PER CURIAM ORDER.

For reasons to be stated in an opinion later to be filed, it is this 3rd day of February, 2006

ORDERED, by the Court of Appeals of Maryland, that the respondent, Eric Jag Kapoor, be, and he is hereby, disbarred, effective immediately, from the further practice of law in the State of Maryland; and it is further

ORDERED, that the Clerk of this Court shall strike the name of Eric Jag Kapoor from the register of attorneys, and pursuant to Maryland Rule 16-713, shall certify that fact to the Trustees of the Client Protection Fund and the Clerks of all judicial tribunals in the State; and it is further

ORDERED, that the respondent shall pay all costs as taxed by the Clerk of this Court, including the costs of all transcripts, pursuant to Maryland Rule 16-715(c), for which sum judgment is entered in favor of the Attorney Grievance Commission of Maryland against Eric Jag Kapoor.
